description: Retrieves the firewall configurations that you have defined. DNS Firewall uses the configurations to manage firewall behavior for your VPCs. A single call might return only a partial list of the configurations. For information, see MaxResults.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects that you want Resolver to return for this request. If more objects are available, in the response, Resolver provides a NextToken value that you can use in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects. If you don't specify a value for MaxResults, Resolver returns up to 100 objects.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: For the first call to this list request, omit this value. When you request a list of objects, Resolver returns at most the number of objects specified in MaxResults. If more objects are available for retrieval, Resolver returns a NextToken value in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, use the token that was returned for the prior request in your next request.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If objects are still available for retrieval, Resolver returns this token in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, provide this token in your next request.

nested_items.name: FirewallConfigs
nested_items.description: The configurations for the firewall behavior provided by DNS Firewall for VPCs from Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC).

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID of the firewall configuration.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC that this firewall configuration applies to.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the VPC that this firewall configuration applies to.

nested_items.name: FirewallFailOpen
nested_items.description: Determines how DNS Firewall operates during failures, for example when all traffic that is sent to DNS Firewall fails to receive a reply.

By default, fail open is disabled, which means the failure mode is closed. This approach favors security over availability. DNS Firewall returns a failure error when it is unable to properly evaluate a query.
If you enable this option, the failure mode is open. This approach favors availability over security. DNS Firewall allows queries to proceed if it is unable to properly evaluate them.
